item.title: Bramble: A Purely Functional Build System and Package Manager
item.description: About a year and a half ago I decided to start working on a build system inspired by Nix called Bramble. Andrew Chambers had launched hermes and I was messing around with starlark-go a bit and it seemed like writing a Nix-inspired functional build system with Starlark would be a nice way to better understand how they work. Bramble is no longer a test project, and has matured into something that I think has a few interesting ideas worth sharing.

item.title: Strategies for Binary Relocation In Functional Build Systems
item.description: I’m currently writing a toy Nix/Guix called Bramble to learn more about the inner workings of both systems. One of the features that I wanted to include in my version was “binary relocation”. Both Nix and Guix have hardcoded store paths that are baked into all the outputs that they produce. If we take a look at part of a simple nix Derivation you’ll see that these paths are hardcoded directly in the file.
